searchengine.dictionary
Class HashDictionary

java.lang.Object
  searchengine.dictionary.HashDictionary
All Implemented Interfaces:
DictionaryInterface
public class HashDictionary
extends java.lang.Object
implements DictionaryInterface

This Class implements a HashDictionary implementing the interface DictionaryInterface,which maps key's to values. Any non-null object can be used as a key or as a value.

To successfully store and retrieve objects from HashDictionary, the String Object used as keys and the Object as value's for the key is stored. An instance of HashDictionary has no parameters, use's the the default load factor (.75) offers a good tradeoff between time and space costs. Higher values decrease the space overhead but increase the time cost to look up an entry (which is reflected in most Hashtable operations, including get and put).

This example creates a HashDictionary of words. It uses the names of the word as keys: 

     HashDictionary  words= new HashDictionary();
     words.insert("one", new Integer(1));
     words.insert("two", new Integer(2));
     words.insert("three", new Integer(3));

To retrieve a number, use the following code: 

     Integer n = (Integer)words.getValue("two");
     if (n != null) {
         System.out.println("two = " + n);
     }

Constructor Summary
HashDictionary()
          Constructs a new, empty hashtable with a default initial capacity (11) and load factor, which is 0.75.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String[] getKeys()
          getKeys functions returns all the Keys present in the HashDictionary as a String Array.

          getValue returns the value for the key(str) if found in the hashtable else returns null
 void insert(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object value)
          Maps the specified key to the specified value in this HashDictionary.
 void remove(java.lang.String key)
          remove function removes the key and value from the HashTable if found in the hashtable

insert

public void insert(java.lang.String key,
                   java.lang.Object value)
Maps the specified key to the specified value in this HashDictionary. Neither the key nor the value can be null.

The value can be retrieved by calling the getValue method with a key that is equal to the original key.

Specified by:
insert in interface DictionaryInterface
Parameters:
key - the HashDictionary key.
value - the value.
See Also:
getValue(String)

remove

public void remove(java.lang.String key)
remove function removes the key and value from the HashTable if found in the hashtable

Specified by:
remove in interface DictionaryInterface
Parameters:
key -
